column2: Well-respected war leaders in their own right, High Elf Nobles have developed their considerable skill-at-arms over many years of intensive experience in melee combat.
The Lizardmen's Saurus Scar-Veterans are highly-seasoned melee fighters, with few equals among their adversaries on the field.
High Magic practitioners, proficient in using all the Winds of Magic, are supremely powerful beings whose spells are way beyond ordinary mortal understanding.
Pyromancers are effectively magical artillery, due to the Lore of Fire's selection of aggressive spells, but are not necessarily the most powerful.
Sudden, unnatural gales and lethal bolts of Warp-lightning from the sky, ground-splitting earthquakes and scorching fire from the soil – each one delivered in the Horned Rat’s undying name.
Vicious in hand-to-hand combat, these shapeshifting spirit-creatures prey on the unsuspecting.
Fast moving and with a long range, missile cavalry excel at harassing their enemies, but are weak if pinned in melee.
Fearsome beasts, armed with a pair of lethal throwing axes – running away will not help.
The Lore of Death is an offensive lore with a suite of spells that can assassinate enemy characters and decimate entire units!
Tormented souls, now freed from their spiritual prison, burst forth in a flash of blinding light to seek out the foe and deliver unbearable madness and death to their door.
Light is a defensive Lore concentrated on augmentation spells, especially useful against Undead and Daemonic creatures.
The Warrior Priests of Sigmar are powerful fighters whose battle prayers can further bolster their followers' resolve.
The Lore of Nehekhara is focused on damage, either applied directly to the enemy or by enhancing the attack of your Undead legions.
Hammers take little notice of armour, causing massive amounts of damage regardless of where they hit. Managing to score a hit can be very challenging though...
The scythe is a clumsy weapon in combat not suited for parries or blocks. However, if the wielder is ethereal, it doesn't matter.
Pyromancers are effectively magical artillery, due to the Lore of Fire's selection of aggressive spells, but are not necessarily the most powerful.
The sword's main advantage in combat is its flexibility. It can be used offensively and defensively, and offers a good compromise between regular and armour-piercing damage.
Fast moving and with a long range, missile cavalry excel at harassing their enemies, but are weak if pinned in melee.
The Lore of Death is an offensive lore with a suite of spells that can assassinate enemy characters and decimate entire units!
The Lore of Life heals those who control it by taking the lifeforce of their opponents!
Brutal beasts, striding into battle to wreak havoc.
Monstrous creatures are typically several feet taller than men and capable of stomping weaker foes into the ground.
It is the Bretonnians that have taken the art of flying cavalry and made it their own.
Flying cavalry have the advantages enjoyed by more traditional mounted units but with an even greater range.
The Lore of Metal is full of hexes and high-damage spells; heavily-armoured units are particularly susceptible.
Bretonnian Knights are masters of cavalry-based close combat.
This master of magick uses power generated from the Deliverance of Itza to destroy both armies and cities.
Flying cavalry have all the advantages of more traditional mounted units, but with an even greater range.
The Lore of the Deep draws power from the depths of the seas to disrupt the enemy's plans and drown their crews.
Big Bosses are surprisingly capable in melee, although they will find facing the champions of other races a challenge.
The Squigs’ fearsome mandibles can crack skulls with ease, gobbling men up like so many mushrooms in a feeding trough.
This Engineer puts his ingenuity into field-testing handgun accuracy and range.
Nature can be both shield and weapon, brought to bear against the enemy or to defend allied troops.
Wolves, hounds and other beasts bred for war. Their claws and jaws can crack skulls, but they struggle against decent armour.
The Captains of men are oft-times great fighters as well as leaders.
Extremely short-range troops, who cause high-impact damage to their foes.
Forever in Khaine's service, on the battlefield the heartless Witch Elves carry a pair of poisoned daggers with which to do their endless, bloody work.
These large-winged monsters are the most powerful creatures in the world.
Proficient in melee and missile combat alike, a fast mount grants this Lord much tactical flexibility.
The near-immortal Dragon Ogres bellow their rage at the younger races and hit hard when they charge.
An indelicate weapon at the best of times, the cudgel is doubly-crushing when wielded by a cold-blooded Skink.
A well-timed charge by these near-unstoppable cavalry units can cause devastating damage.
Drawn from the skies, the Lore of Heavens is a mix of augmentation spells and powers with potentially devastating consequences for the enemy.
Sudden, unnatural gales and lethal bolts of Warp-lightning from the sky, ground-splitting earthquakes and scorching fire from the soil – each one delivered in the Horned Rat’s undying name.
These gifted warriors are also master magic-users, each with a faultless grasp of the principles of magical lore.
Nature can be both shield and weapon, brought to bear against the enemy or to defend allied troops.
Either thrown or used in melee, the Spear of Kurnous offers superior reach over a sword or axe, making it an ideal choice against larger enemies.
High Magic practitioners, proficient in using all the Winds of Magic, are supremely powerful beings whose spells are way beyond ordinary mortal understanding.
The Cygor is a beast without peer, hurling rocks from afar to smash enemies before they can close on its imposing physique.
Light is a defensive Lore concentrated on augmentation spells, especially useful against Undead and Daemonic creatures.
In the right hands, the barbed whip makes a mockery of even the most skilful warrior, keeping the foe off balance and unable to press their attack.
Flying cavalry have the advantage of more traditional mounted units, but with an even greater range.
A Warrior Priest on horseback can preach and fight at greater speed.
The Lore of Nehekhara is focused on damage, either applied directly to the enemy or by enhancing the attack of your Undead legions.
These larger-than-usual beasts bear down upon their enemies on the battlefield, rending them apart with bestial fury and cruel determination.
Pyromancers are effectively magical artillery, due to the Lore of Fire's selection of aggressive spells, but are not necessarily the most powerful.
Towering over the battlefield, statues that once stood sentinel over Nehekhara’s elaborate temples now direct their great strength and fury against the Tomb Kings' many foes.
Built to destroy massed ranks with its fiery breath, the Hydra strikes terror into its opponents and can heal its own wounds.
The Lore of Death is an offensive lore with a suite of spells that can assassinate enemy characters and decimate entire units!
When enraged in battle, the plumage of the majestic Flamespyre Phoenix combusts, leaving angry, deadly fire trailing behind it.
The Lore of Life heals those who control it, whilst taking the lifeforce of their opponents!
These Cold Ones hunt down their prey in small packs. Although used by Dark Elves too, they are best controlled by Lizardmen.
The courage to walk Dark Magic's more direct, immediate, and dangerous path to spellcraft requires an uncanny sharpness of mind and bloody-minded determination.
With a long range, Bolt Throwers are able to cause great damage but are very weak in melee.
Near unstoppable on the charge, these masses of fur, muscle and tusks can break through the strongest enemies.
By the Lady, this Bretonnian champion excels in melee!
Fast moving and with a long range, missile cavalry excel at harassing their enemies, but are weak if pinned in melee.
Wielding an ancestral axe, a Thane is a melee champion of Hold and Clan.
The Lore of Life heals those who control it by taking the lifeforce of their opponents!
Pyromancers are effectively magical artillery, due to the Lore of Fire's selection of aggressive spells, but are not necessarily the most powerful.
Fast-moving cavalry, able to fire whilst flying above their enemies.
Short-range missile infantry that won't win a gunfight on their own, but can pin down a foe.
Fast and good against smaller targets, cavalry also has more staying power in melee than the charge-focussed shock cavalry.
The near-immortal Dragon Ogres bellow their rage at the younger races and hit hard when they charge.
A support infantry unit reinforces others with its aura and strikes foes with powerful magical attacks.
Captains are also warriors who excel in melee from horseback.
Armed with razor-sharp daggers, these Goblins strike hard, causing lethal armour piercing damage before scurrying away under a confounding cloud of smoke.
Rockets' inaccuracy does not matter much considering the wide area of devastation they cause.
The courage to walk Dark Magic's more direct, immediate, and dangerous path to spellcraft requires an uncanny sharpness of mind and bloody-minded determination.
As the Saurus wield their sword-maces they are fighting two foes: their opponent and their own primal instincts.
Wizards who harness the Lore of Shadows use aggressive spells to scythe through enemy hearts!
To fight from the back of a rearing Pegasus takes great skill - use his mobility to strike where the fighting is thickest.
More than just highly-trained assassins, the Hands of the Shadow Crown will ensure their mission's success no matter the cost.
Once on a wolf or a giant spider, a Big Boss is far more mobile - able to boost da boyz' resolve when required.
These monsters smash their foes to pieces with huge, armour-rending weapons.
These units excel in the thick of the fight, tearing the foe to shreds with savage strength and wild abandon.
Javelin-armed missile infantry cause high damage, but only over a short range.
What two-handed axes lack in elegance, they make up for in brutal, armour-shattering force.
Fast-moving cavalry that can take to the skies, raining down damage from above at range.
The fanatical Plague Monks use their censers to spread virulent diseases as well as for flailing their unfortunate opponents to an ignoble, unmerciful death.
Spears offer superior reach over swords and axes, generally making them the better choice against large enemies.
Although short of range due to being hand-thrown in battle, do not discount the effectiveness of quick-firing, massed throwing stars against tightly-packed opponents!
Fast and good against smaller targets, cavalry also has more staying power in melee than the charge-focused shock cavalry.
Nature can be both shield and weapon, brought to bear against the enemy or to defend allied troops.
As the Nehekharan gods’ chosen, Ushabti can crush mere men into the sands with their looming girth, never to be seen again.

Although hand-thrown and therefore short-range by design, there's nothing weak about the virulent maladies contained within these globes, as those caught in their blast would testify if indeed they'd lived to tell the tale!
Frontline soldiers trained for hand-to-hand combat with their enemies.
The Big Waaagh! is a big bombastic lore with lots of intimidating, large spells that meter out damage to the enemy.
The glaive is a large, lethal, bladed weapon with improved armour-piercing capabilities.
The Champions of Chaos are brutal and merciless in combat, when mounted they can close with the enemy more quickly.
Towering over their enemies, these living trees protect the forest with brute force when necessary.
Tomb Banshees are screaming wretches - ethereal beings with a short-range wailing attack.
The Lore of Life heals those who control it by taking the lifeforce of their opponents!
The aged, cooled Frostheart Phoenix no longer possesses the fire it once commanded, but remains a hardy, formidable battlefield opponent.
Winged creatures who prey on weaker foes in hand-to-hand combat.
These siege engines are perfect for firing over your own battle line and over walls, but they are generally less accurate than cannons.
The Mourngul Haunter is a terrifying monster able to stalk its prey and cause high levels of damage to any foe.
Wolves, hounds and other beasts bred for war. Their claws and jaws can splinter bone, but they struggle with decent armour.
The sword's main advantage in combat is flexibility. It can be used offensively and defensively, and it offers a good compromise between regular damage and armour piercing damage.

Although hand-thrown and therefore short range by design, there's nothing weak about the virulent maladies contained within these globes, as those caught in their blast would testify if indeed they'd lived to tell the tale!
The Lore of the Deep draws power from the depths of the seas to disrupt the enemy's plans and drown their crews.
These wretched, ethereal beings charm unfortunate mortals into willingly meeting their demise.
These Skaven Death Runners are armed with Warpstone and magic-infused 'Weeping Blades', to melt armour and make even the merest scratch a fatal flesh wound.
Frontline soldiers trained for hand-to-hand combat with their enemies.
Virulent disease - insidious, creeping, contagions leading to hideous infirmity, madness and death. If ever pestilence needed a helping hand, this Wizard provides it.
Monstrous creatures are typically several feet taller than men, and capable of stomping weaker foes into the ground.
Gunnery Wights make the Vampire Coast's gunline hold fast, replenishing troops' ammunition to keep them in the fight.
Although armed with crude cudgels, a scratch from their filth-encrusted, poisonous claws is more dangerous to most living beings.
Fast moving and with a long range, missile cavalry excel at harassing their enemies, but are weak if pinned in melee.
Tomb Scorpions suddenly burst from beneath the sand right into the centre of the fray, using surprise and savagery to quickly gain the advantage.
Fast, and good against smaller targets, cavalry also have more staying power in melee than charge-focused shock cavalry.
An ambushing force that can attack with mattock and blasting charges.
The Big Waaagh! is a big bombastic lore with lots of intimidating, large spells that meter out damage to the enemy.
The Champions of Chaos are brutal and merciless in combat.
Witch Hunters are hardy fighters but have good missile capabilities as well.
The Champions of Chaos are brutal and merciless in combat, especially when mounted on monstrous beasts.
Fast and good when fighting infantry, this cavalry unit can also cast aggressive spells.
Ferocious infantry specialising in brutal hand-to-hand combat.
Goblin Shamans use spells from the Little Waaagh!, a collection of vindictive spells that can really hurt their opponents.
Pyromancers are effectively magical artillery, due to the Lore of Fire's selection of aggressive spells, but are not necessarily the most powerful.
Medium-range units specialising in large opponents whilst also being competent when fighting hand-to-hand.
The beasts of the world rise up and obey when summoned, their very essence used to empower and transform the caster.
These smaller cannons, guns and flamethrowers are primarily used against units, not buildings.
Spears offer superior reach over swords and axes, generally making them the better choice against large enemies.
The Lore of Metal is full of hexes and high-damage spells; units with lots of armour are particularly susceptible.
The beasts of the world rise up and obey when summoned, their very essence used to empower and transform the caster.
Fast moving, with a wide turning circle, Chariots can punch through weak enemy units but are vulnerable if pinned in combat.
Spells from the Lore of Vampires are used to summon and shackle Undead minions, and curse them too!
Loosing arrows the size of four men, this enormous skeleton punishes the enemy from long range.
Short-range units that can harass the enemy before laying into them with powerful close-combat attacks.
Atop their monstrous, snake-like, living statues, Necropolis Knights only need swipe their mounts' mighty tails to shatter the bones of the unfortunate foe.
A special chariot supports surrounding units with its aura and strikes foes with powerful magical attacks.
Skinks with blowpipes use poison darts at short range, with a high rate of fire; they can also fire whilst moving.
Some Lords are just as deadly with a missile weapon as they are with blade, axe or hammer.
Long-range units that provide support for melee infantry, but are comparatively weak in close combat.
Armed with the lethal Great Bow of the Desert, Ushabti can rain furious death and devastation upon the foe without ever getting too close.
Drawn from the skies, the Lore of Heavens is a mix of augmentation spells and powers with potentially devastating consequences for the enemy.
Similar to spears, halberds are a good choice against large enemies. They are heavier than spears, giving them the edge against armour.
Fast and good against smaller targets, cavalry also has more staying power in melee than the charge-focused shock cavalry.
Similar to spears, halberds are a good choice against large enemies. They are heavier than spears, giving them the edge against armour.
The beasts of the world rise up and obey when summoned, their very essence used to empower and transform the caster.
The sword's main advantage in combat is flexibility. It can be used offensively and defensively, and it offers a good compromise between regular and armour-piercing damage.
Greenskins ride to war on myriad beasts. Goblin Cavalry is typically light, but fast and manoeuvrable.
Having a Runelord in the presence of grateful Clans-Dwarfs bolsters their abilities.
Fast and good against smaller targets, this cavalry unit also has greater staying power in melee than charge-focused shock cavalry.
These deadly Skaven melee masters are armed with swords with which to cut a disease-ridden swathe through enemy lines.

Never discount the humble sling, lest you get a very nasty surprise courtesy of an expert trained from childhood in its deadliest of uses! Slings have a high arc of fire and are best used at medium range.
Fast moving and with a long range, missile cavalry excel at harassing their enemies, but are weak if pinned in melee.
Goblin Shamans use spells from the Little Waaagh!, a collection of vindictive spells that can really hurt their opponents.
The beasts of the world rise up and obey when summoned, their very essence used to empower and transform the caster.
A well-timed charge by these near-unstoppable cavalry units can cause devastating damage.
High-threat infantry that can disrupt and damage their enemies with exploding firearms.
Fearless as only those who have ‘survived’ death truly can be, Tomb Princes use their mighty halberds to turn away the blows and brace against the weight of large opponents.
Fast moving and with a long range, missile cavalry excel at harassing their enemies, but are weak if pinned in melee.
Wizards mix of spells from the lores of Vampires and Shadows to summon and shackle Undead minions, whilst also aggressively scything through enemies' hearts!
Wizards who harness the Lore of Shadows can cast aggressive spells to scythe through enemy hearts!
With vision as sharp as a bird’s, these precision archers can target and destroy their foes before disappearing just as quickly as they appeared.
Virulent disease - insidious, creeping, contagions leading to hideous infirmity, madness and death. If ever pestilence needed a helping hand, this Wizard provides it.
Atop their monstrous, snake-like, living statues, Necropolis Knights only need swipe their mounts' mighty tails to shatter the bones of the unfortunate foe.
The Big Waaagh! is a big bombastic lore with lots of intimidating, large spells that meter out damage to the enemy.
Those who once stood dormant for centuries, silently guarding Nehekhara’s cities and tombs, are now imbued with magical vigour to unleash furious carnage upon the foe.
Missile specialists that can thin enemy ranks, either through supreme accuracy, greater range or sheer armour penetration.
Wizards who harness the Lore of Shadows use aggressive spells to scythe through enemy hearts!
Long-range units that provide support for melee infantry, but are comparatively weak in close combat.
Frontline soldiers trained for hand-to-hand combat with their enemies.
Masters of the patient ambush, Sepulchral Stalkers strike at the most opportune moment, surprising and impaling their prey before fixing the terrified foe with their deadly gaze.
These monsters are Vampires consumed by the animalistic hunter within. They are powerful in attack against infantry and other characters.
Towering over the battlefield, this monster can both cause damage from range and at close quarters.
The Wight King is an ancient warrior who was rarely bested in his mortal life or this one.
The Lore of Death is an offensive lore with a suite of spells that can assassinate enemy characters and decimate entire units!
The sword's main advantage in combat is its flexibility. It can be used offensively and defensively, and offers a good compromise between regular and armour-piercing damage.
Wolves, hounds and other beasts bred for war. Their claws and jaws can splinter bone, but they struggle with decent armour.
Wizards who harness the Lore of Shadows use aggressive spells to scythe through enemy hearts!
Large, fast and agile, these savage beasts relish combat and are capable of taking down much larger foes.
Greenskins ride to war on myriad beasts. Goblin Cavalry is typically light, but fast and manoeuvrable.
With the sole purpose of causing carnage, this monster will explode on contact with the enemy.
Masters of both sword and bow, Glade Lords can cause great damage from near or afar.
Swift and silent, the scouts of the Dark Elf race are stealthy soldiers, further braced by the unforgiving conditions of the Blackspine Mountains from which they hail.

Of the many shocking, hideous abominations created by Skavenkind, the magically-resistant horrors of the Hell Pit are hand-reared and fed just enough to make them more than a little dangerous in battle.
These Cold Ones can pierce armour with their spears and perform particularly well against large opponents. Although used by Dark Elves too, they are best controlled by Lizardmen.
The beasts of the world rise up and obey when summoned, their very essence used to empower and transform the caster.
What two-handed axes lack in elegance, they make up for in brutal, armour-shattering force.
The Lore of Metal is full of hexes and high-damage spells; units with lots of armour are particularly susceptible.
Drawn from the skies, the Lore of Heavens is a mix of augmentation spells and powers with potentially devastating consequences for the enemy.
As the elite warriors of the Skaven army, the black-furred Stormvermin are armed with halberds with which to carry out their precision melee assault.
Wizards who harness the Lore of Shadows use aggressive spells to scythe through enemy hearts!
By the Lady, this Bretonnian champion excels in melee!
The Lore of Death is an offensive lore with a suite of spells that can assassinate enemy characters and decimate entire units!
Fast moving, with a wide turning circle, Chariots can punch through weak enemy units, but are vulnerable if pinned in combat.
Masters of both spear and bow, Handmaidens of the Everqueen are equipped to protect the Asur from any threat.
Dinosaurs are mostly feral; as such, they are difficult to control and prone to rampaging.
Having a Runesmith in the presence of grateful Clans-Dwarfs bolsters their abilities.
Towering over the battlefield, this monster will decimate smaller enemies coming its way with lethal force.
Fast moving machines capable of breaking enemy lines and holding their own in close combat.
Spells from the Lore of Vampires are used to summon and shackle Undead minions, and curse them too!
These large, winged monsters are some of the most powerful creatures in the world.
These smaller cannons, guns and flamethrowers are primarily used against units, not buildings.
The greatsword is a large, balanced weapon with improved armour-piercing capabilities.
These highly-trained skirmishers are also proficient in melee, with the well-honed discipline to form a spear wall that can meet all-comers head on.
Fast moving units with a wide turning circle, they can punch through weak enemy units, but are vulnerable if pinned in melee.
The near-immortal Dragon Ogres bellow their rage at the younger races and hit hard when they charge.
Hammers pay little notice to armour, dealing massive amounts of damage regardless of where they hit.
Some dinosaurs carry a platform with which to support their army, either by buffing surrounding friendly units or devastating their foes.
Just as stealthy as others of their kind, these Dark Elf Shades carry two deadly blades in addition to their lethal bows.
The Lore of Metal is full of hexes and high-damage spells; heavily-armoured units are particularly susceptible.
Large, fast and agile. These savage beasts relish combat.
A steam-powered, full-metal war machine boasting a cannon and an autonomous, short-range turret.
Terradons, fragile yet extremely fast, can soar above the battlefield to drop a single load (usually rocks) upon the unsuspecting foe; their riders carry fireleech bolas or javelins.
Short-range units that are equally proficient with black powder weapons as they are wielding their blades.
Light is a defensive Lore concentrated on augmentation spells, especially useful against Undead and Daemonic creatures.
Some dinosaurs carry a platform with which to support their army, either by buffing surrounding friendly units or devastating their foes.
The Lore of Death is an offensive lore with a suite of spells that can assassinate enemy characters and decimate entire units!
The Lore of Nehekhara is focused on damage, either applied directly to the enemy or by enhancing the attack of your Undead legions.
Greenskins ride to war on myriad beasts. Goblin Cavalry is typically light, but fast and manoeuvrable.
These large, winged monsters are some of the most powerful creatures in the world.
There's nothing the feared, lethal assassins of Clan Eshin don't know about hand-to-hand combat and securing that essential kill in the unforgiving cut-and-thrust of melee.
Fast moving and with a long range, missile cavalry excel at harassing their enemies, but are weak if pinned in melee.
Second in stature only to the priestly-class, the wily Skink Chiefs are masters of both clandestine mayhem and irregular, skirmish warfare.
A launcher of (more-or-less) guided, insane, living missiles that are primarily used against infantry targets.
The Lore of Metal is full of hexes and high-damage spells; units with lots of armour are particularly susceptible.
Radiating a sinister aura of magic, Hierotitans judge and execute the guilty with matchless strength and peerless brutality.
Fast and good when fighting infantry, this cavalry unit can also cast aggressive spells.
Larger, mounted ferocious beasts able to dismantle infantry with ease, whilst being able to cause additional damage from range through their riders.
Wizards who harness the Lore of Shadows use aggressive spells to scythe through enemy hearts!
The Wight King is an ancient warrior who was rarely bested in his mortal life or this one.
The Lore of Death is an offensive lore with a suite of spells that can assassinate enemy characters and decimate entire units!
Huge beasts of war, powerful beyond reckoning, take to the battlefield with enormous weapons capable of felling the mightiest warrior.
The Temple Guard, armed with a halberd -mace, are the only Saurus Infantry disciplined enough never to rampage.
Hunting in large packs, these fast-moving creatures can both attack from range or cause considerable damage at close quarters.
A true monster killer in every sense, able to take on the largest of foes in combat and inflict great damage upon them with ease.
Masters of both sword and bow, Waystalkers can cause great damage from near or afar.
The Lore of Metal is full of hexes and high-damage spells; units with lots of armour are particularly susceptible.
Drawn from the skies, the Lore of Heavens is a mix of augmentation spells and powers with potentially devastating consequences for the enemy.
Towering over the battlefield, statues that once stood sentinel over Nehekhara’s elaborate temples now direct their great strength and fury against the Tomb Kings' many foes.
You can be stealthy whilst carrying a great weapon; these Shades have long-mastered use of terrain combined with silent movement to take their opponents (very nastily) by surprise.
These larger-than-usual beasts bear down upon their enemies in battle, rending them apart with bestial fury and cruel determination.
Fast-moving cavalry that can take to the skies, raining down explosive damage from above.
Short-range missile infantry that shower the enemy in fiery alchemical fury!
Cannons and mortars are accurate artillery pieces that cause a lot of damage to a very focused area, making them ideal for taking out strong, single targets.
Pyromancers are effectively magical artillery, due to the Lore of Fire's selection of aggressive spells, but are not necessarily the most powerful.
Spells from the Lore of Vampires are used to summon and shackle Undead minions, and curse them too!
These larger-than-usual beasts bear down upon their enemies on the battlefield, rending them apart with bestial fury and cruel determination.
An eight-legged arachnid monster that offers a surprisingly smooth ride for its bow-wielding passengers.
There can be no rest for those born - and reborn to Unlife - whose lot is only to toil for their Tomb King's eternal grandeur.
Monstrous creatures are typically several feet taller than men and capable of stomping weaker foes into the ground.
Fast, and good against smaller targets, cavalry also have more staying power in melee than charge-focused shock cavalry.
Light is a defensive Lore concentrated on augmentation spells, especially useful against Undead and Daemonic creatures.
Medium-range missile infantry that fire high-explosive torpedoes.
Flying cavalry have the advantage of more traditional mounted units, but with an even greater range.
These missile-armed Dark Elves carry short-range handbows to cause maximum damage up close before, like all the best skirmishers, feinting to range to begin all over again.
Dark Elf Death Hags are the keepers of Khaine's bloody mysteries; they mix murderous medicines, then dip and use their poisoned blades deftly in melee.
Thanks to their flying Dark Pegasus mounts, these Dark Riders can hunt their prey with impunity.
Some Lords are just as deadly with a missile weapon as they are with blade, axe or hammer.
Flying machines equipped with guns and bombs. As a last resort, they can go into melee and slash at enemies with their rotor blades.
Armour is little barrier to maces, and as such they cause great damage wherever they hit. However, actually scoring a hit can be a challenge, as a large spiky ball can easily miss its mark.
Khaine's chosen assassins are trained from the very beginning of their lives to kill up close in the name of the Bloody-handed God.
A well-timed charge by these near-unstoppable cavalry units can cause devastating damage.
